caption: On our trip to Portland we stopped by Shipyard Brewing company. I was told that the tap room recently opened up and we were sure to experience it. Tables were far apart (excellent adherence to Covid-19 regulations). We ordered two flights (4 Oz pours x4 for only $10). The beer selection is excellent (20 types of beers) to choose from. The Sea Dog Blue Paw blueberry wheat ale was by far our favorite! Light and delicious with an excellent blueberry flavor that is not overpowering. I must find where to buy this ale and get some. There is a cute gift shop by the restaurant as well where we picked up cute lobster Maine shot glasses.
Staff are very nice. Great atmosphere. Not to mention the tasting room is excellent.
The Sunfish brew is amazing!! My new favorite wheat ale!
very disrespecful staff and horrible food wouldn't recommend to anyone

The tasting room is very spacious and has a great atmosphere. Customer service was great and we even got recommendations for other bars/breweries in the area to visit. Both of us got beer flights. My favorites were Sunfish and Blue Paw Blueberry Ale. Would highly recommend visiting this brewery!

This place is great! Huge beer selection. There were about 20 choices when we went. Inside seating area is large and clean. Lots of merch too. Our server was fantastic, he gave us a few free samples without us even asking, doesnt get better then that!
Great service and the beers were fantastic! Lots of interesting flavors to sample. All were delicious. Will definitely return.
The feliz navi stout is excellent
Awesome staff! Took the time to explain the different flavors etc..Fun experience for sure since I never had other types of Shipyard beer before besides the pumpkinhead one.
Tasty, trendy, friendly and fun. Nice staff and great grill food make this a great pub stop for noon or dinner. Wish I had more time to sample all the goodies and the local brews. worth the walk.
Cozy and fun atmosphere
Cozy, fun brewery.
Great selection of draft beers and delicious snacks if hungry.
Love the watermelon ale!

Had an absolutely wonderful experience here last night!! All of the staff was super friendly and nice, especially Aaron! We will definitely be coming back again!! Super safe given everything going on with the pandemic. Drinks, pizza and pretzel were great, definitely recommend!
Enjoyed the beer & had great service!
Well-spaced indoor seating, fast service, and fairly wide variety of beers. Only negative was the lack of tap water, but at least bottled water wasn’t pricey ($1).
Cool place to taste a variety of brews!
Great beer, pub, service and store. Could use more available food, but in a Covid time, they did a great job!

This place is incredible. We asked about a few beers and they were highly knowledgeable and informative. I was torn between two beers and after ordering one of them, they brought me the other one on the house! All of the staff was super friendly and gave us many good restaurant recommendations for our time in Portland. We will definitely be back next time we’re in town!
Awesome beer and store!!

Delicious beer, terrible terrible service. Came here yesterday and had to wait 45 minutes at my table for a single flight of beer. Came back today hoping for a better experience. Unfortunately same story. We have been at our table for over half an hour and are just being completely ignored, haven’t even had the opportunity to order. With coronavirus measures in place they are not even busy. This is how you lose customers. Portland has a lot of other options, and if you want somewhere to sit and drink a beer in a timely manner I suggest you go there instead.
Delicious! Don't bother on a holiday though....ran out of the stuff I was most itching to try.
It was everything we expected and more. Great service, beer and non-alcoholic options, and the mix/match for take home beers in the store is exactly what every brewery should be doing!

No tours but fabulous beers served in “Covid-safe” way. Get flights and a pretzel or other food.  Blue Paw Blueberry Ale should definitely be on your list! We can’t stop drinking it. Yummy! 😋 Smashed Pumpkin 🎃 is another favorite.  Gift shop is great too- time to stock up on gifts 🎁!
Yummy pretzels with AMAZING mustard

I’d like to give the guy reading names off the list the benefit of the doubt that he’s had a long day on a busy Saturday. However, when I asked how to put my wife and my names on the list, I wasn’t even done with my question when he angrily said “if I add more names to this list we’ll never get anyone seated” and stormed off. All I wanted was a pint of my favorite pumpkin beer and some merchandise since we are visiting from 7 hours away. Very turned off and disappointed.
Great beer and food. Friendly staff and quick service.
Cool place and friendly staff, but the beer wasn't great compared to what else is available in the area. Really enjoyed the pumpkin ale though.
Lovely staff, good beer.
PUMPKIN
It is an excellent brewery to visit. They have cool merchandise for sale. I highly recommend this place.

The beer tastes like yeast.....disgusting. When I walked in the smell or beer overwhelmed me, they should put a sign up warning you about the smell as well as the taste of the beer. The carrots on the other hand were the perfect texture and I highly suggest you request the chef to make them
Great brews!!!
I'm a big fan of shipyard brewing!!
Best beer by far.

Came in on a Wednesday at around 1 PM to try a few flights. They have some indoor seating, but we opted for the outdoor tent. Shortly after we were seated, there were a few parties lining up to wait for a table, so we were lucky we didn't have to wait.  A flight of four beers is $10 so my fiance and I got a flight each. Here is what we had:  CBD Organic Blueberry Seltzer - was intrigued since neither of us had a CBD drink before, but this tasted like a raspberry Emergen-C  Tap O' The Morning - this was an Irish stout, which I didn't think I would like since I don't like maple, but it ended up being one of my favorites of the flights  Shipyard Summer Ale - light and refreshing. Since we went at the beginning of September, I really appreciated the fact that they still had summer beers but were also bringing out the fall beers already too  Smashed Pumpkin - not a fan of pumpkin beers but fiance loved this one  Melon - this was so good! So much so that we ended up buying some to bring back. Trying to hold onto summer for as long as I can  Sunfish - another good summer beer. It's grapefruit and it's very light  Blue Paw Blueberry Ale - didn't care for this. I'm starting to think I just don't like blueberry drinks  Black is Beautiful - I love stouts but even this one was a bit too bitter for me  Really glad we got to try all these beers. Flights are usually hit or miss but we liked most of the beers we tried.  Note - the servers are really nice, but some of the staff working in the store are a bit rude. They will straight up see you waiting by the register to ask a question and then purposely walk away.  Tip - they close at 6 PM so make sure to come early!

Amazing beers! This was my favorite brewery in Maine, I picked up a hat and a shirt it was that good. Do the flight! I got the cbd blueberry, tap o the morning, finder all amazing. The smashing pumpkin blew me away it’s mike the pumpkin head but better more pumpkin and flavor. The staff is amazing, plenty of outside seating. Great time!
Great beer and staff.
Some of my favorite beers period

I've been to quite a few breweries. I've done a lot of tastings. And I've even had Shipyard before since they distribute several brews in Utica, NY. But boy, coming right off the tap, unreal. We had flights and they were all very, very good. My favorites were Pumpkinhead (my new favorite pumpkin beer), the blueberry, and the Hazy IPA. Wonderful flavored and not too heavy. Great variety. The facility itself was clean, spacious and wait staff was very good. Had a great time.
The best deal is their four 5oz pours. You can select from 12+ flavors of beer. Recommend to go with a friend or group.
Disappointing experience. Beer was average and there was construction all around as well as an underwhelming outdoor space to adapt with Covid.
Great place to have a drink outdoors.  I tried the mango beer tea and it is delicious. Great deal on this in the store too.
Visited the brewery a few years ago and it was a great time. Enjoyed the tour and the brews! Will visit again if I ever visit Maine again.
The beer was good, and the gift shop had a good bit of nice things you could buy.
I Liked the Blue Finn Stout.   Very convenient from our hotel.  It had a tourist vibe, but still good.
Mediocre beer compared to the beer scene Portland has created over the past few years

Tried eating here, have some food allergy issues and the waitress wasn’t helpful at all. Got the food and it clearly wasn’t as discussed. Didn’t offer to remove from bill and didn’t feel like asking for manager. Paid for meal I didn’t eat...  maybe post allergic menu info online or provide in restaurant??....
Super cheap flights and a great atmosphere. My favorite brewery we visited.
Great brewery in the heart of Portland. Very affordable pricing for flights and a great gift shop.
Great variety of beer flavors, very good prices, great atmosphere, and Aaron was very pleasant and helpful!

Opens and closes whenever they want. Would have been nice to find the open on time this morning when we arrived at 10. But asked when they open and was told “you never know” so sitting here eating chips from vending at Portland airport

Easy to get to, the brewery is near to downtown Portland, and when you get there the staff are extremely welcoming.  The beer flights are great fun and so are the numerous games both electronic and board games that are on offer.  I can’t recommend the Shipyard brewery enough.  We had an enjoyable visit🍻

We visited Shipyard Brewing on a whim when we were in Portland and were so glad we did! The price and selection for tasting flights was impressive. The beer was great--the mango one was my personal favourite. The atmosphere was fun. We loved that there were games available in the tasting room...we played Cards Against Humanity while sipping our beers which was a perfect combination. Would recommend.

Good brewery to stop by while in Portland. The people inside are very nice and the brewery layout is great. Bring the kids as well, as there is soda on draft for the kids. I enjoyed the Pumpkinhead with the cinnamon sugar rim, not something you see everyday and it was good for sure.  Thanks for the great conversations while we were visiting Portland and for the beers of course. We'll swing by the next time we are in town.
Awesome beer! Love the seasonal beer they had and the imperial pumpkin ale!!
We were looking for something fun to do on our last night in Portland and came across this place. Great place to grab a beer flight and very friendly staff!
Great atmosphere even if alcohol isn't on your menu. Friendly staff AND customers! Highly recommend.
Great brews.  Try a flight or enjoy a great pint.
The blueberry pie is a MUST!!!!!! Friendly folks and delicious beer also ❤️

Awesome brews at a decent price. Has more of a tourist vibe to it as it is attached to their gift shop. Not a bad thing really. So many breweries try to go for the speakeasy hipster vibe, that it makes this place quite unique by being bright and energetic in its presentation.
It has been too long as you can see by the quality of the photos. I guess it is time to go back!
Great brewery with lots of good options along with a nice taproom and giftshop.
One of the best breweries I have been to. The bartender was super nice, the atmosphere was really neat, and the beer was amazing. Definitely recommend if you are in Portland.
Great spot! Took some of my friends here while they were visiting and we had an amazing time. Staff, especially bartenders, are really nice!
Amazing prices for flights. So many tasty beers!
Good food and generous portions. Interior is clean and spacious with some outdoor seating. Staff are friendly and attentive. Expect a long wait for your food to come out, however.

Good brewery in Portland. The people inside are very pleasant and cozy They're working to extend the tasting room. Currently don't serve food, only some snack like chips and pop corn. The beers seem like genuine. We did two flights, served with funny nice black board tray, where you can write four 4 chosen. We tasted the IPA, my favourite was the Finder. Also the melon beer was interesting... If you are in Portland this place worth a visit!
Very friendly and helpful staff
Great prices and a great selection of beer!
Friendly service
Wide selection of beer. Building was crowded and loud. A small gift shop for take home items.
Smelled strongly of perfumed soap and the beer wasn't much better - Avoid the Watermelon beer at all costs!!  Not a great experience overall.

Really good beer and the prices are discounted both in the tasting room and the gift shop...discounted from what you would spend at a bar.  Tours are on hold because they’re expanding their operation.  Processing and bottling is done off site.
Awesome brewery and tasting room. Kid friendly. Note that there were stairs to navigate to get in (5/25/2019). No food available, bit the beers are great.
Beer was delicious. The tasting room is clean and decorated nicely. Busy place! Closed on Sundays!
People are very friendly. Great selection of beers on tapto try. Gift shop has very resonable priced merchandise

First visit to the tasting room. Great atmosphere and great selection of brews. Bought the new Lager, sorry to say I was not impressed. Too hoppy for a lager, very light bodied. But, hey, can't be perfect and I haven't had a second one yet. But the tasting room is a must.
Nice selection with flights or glass

Been buying their beer for years, finally made it to the brewery. My wife and I had so much fun sitting in the guest area drinking our favorite beers and playing games. Definitely will be our number 1 stop when we return to Portland.
Went in to buy IPA. Walked away from the register to look around. Clerk went missing. Walked out. Maybe another day.
Best beer in town and that's saying a lot these days! Also a great spot to get some glasses and drink ware

What a fun place with lots of cool stuff and the Beer tasting was great. I discovered that there are a lot of beers I like that I never would have tried other wise. Blue berry beer was surprisingly good.
Some really good beer and a nice atmosphere
Appears to no longer be at this location! I believe it's getting renovated.
$6 flights, worth it!

The gift shop is impressing. The bartender at the tasteroom was very nice to me and enjoyed chatting a bit. The beer was overly good and there were about 16 beers on tap. If you are in the neighbourhood, it is worth a visit.
Excellent stop on a tour round Portland. Great selection on tap, with a build your own tasting flight option. Service was super friendly and helpful. Every beer we tried was delicious too!
Pumpkinhead is amazing!
Delicious beer - small tour but cool to see the whole process. Pumpkinhead is my favorite!
I love Pumpkinhead! The variety of brews are delightful at Shipyard
(Translated by Google) Excellent beer! It is absolutely necessary to go there!  (Original) Excellente bière! Il faut absolument y aller!
Super cool vibe, but it was WAY crowded and I didn't love the beer.
Cute place with a tasting room.  I can't wait for extended hours

(Translated by Google) Already in Woburn, near Boston, I noticed the pub employees with the distinctive pumpkin head rider on their backs. Ordered beer and found it good, no, pretty decent. So do some research and lo and behold, there is the hut in Portland that produces the stuff and fills it in this incredibly stylishly labeled bottle. Actually, I just wanted this shirt, but contrary to my plan, I ended up on the other side of the swinging door. And the whole thing with four specially put together tasting glasses of unknown types of beer. Fireberry and melon in particular were a huge new discovery for me. The Brewers Choice Pilsener is more or less German-like and finally a beer beyond the overcrowded varieties of some micro-breweries in New England. Incidentally, I had a conversation with the boss, who thanked us for the personal grading of the beers tested. Overall, a very nice place to shop and linger. Highly recommended !!  (Original) Schon in Woburn, Nähe Boston, sind mir die Pub-Mitarbeiterinnen mit dem prägnanten Kürbiskopfreiter auf dem Rücken aufgefallen. Bier bestellt und für gut, nein ziemlich anständig, befunden. Also recherchiert und siehe da, in Portland steht die Hütte, die das Zeug produziert und in dieser unglaublich schick etikettierten Flasche abfüllt. Eigentlich wollte ich nur dieses Shirt haben, bin aber entgegen meines Vorhabens doch noch auf der anderen Seite der Schwingtür gelandet. Und das Ganze mit vier eigens zusammengestellten Probiergläsern mir unbekannter Biersorten. Vor allem Fireberry und Melon waren für mich eine krasse Neuentdeckung. Das Brewers Choice Pilsener ist quasi German-like und endlich ein Bier jenseits der überfruchteten Varianten einiger Micro-Brauereien Neuenglands. Nebenbei noch ins Gespräch mit dem Chef gekommen, der sich umpfänglich für die persönliche Benotung der getesteten Biere bedankte. Insgesamt ein sehr netter Ort zum Einkaufen und Verweilen. Highly recommended!!

Great local brewery!  We stopped in to do some shopping and have a bite to eat.  The shop was perfect, however there wasn't a food option at the Portland location.... however you are able to taste their beer here.  The selection was great and the Make Your Own Flight option was perfect for us.  We ere able to pick the specific beers we wanted to taste and they were kind enough to recommend some places to eat at within walking distance.
Excellent place, great selection of beers.  Friendly and helpful staff.
Nice tap room and merch shop. Did not take tour. Only snacks available

Seriously, they’ve got something for everyone. Compared to other breweries I’ve been to in Boston, Miami, and other parts of Maine, Shipyard is a classic and their prices are reasonable. Shipyard is still a craft brewery. Despite what people say and so for a craft brewery their beer is pretty good not gunna lie. Is everything on tap a 10/10 no, but there is something for everyone. Definitely worth a trip. Also, their growler membership is SO worth it!
Great service and excellent beer.
Great price for a flight. Cool flavors in tap. Definitely worth the stop.
#5 Hoppie - Perfect!!

Came up to Portland on a day trip with a friend, stopped by here in the afternoon. Staff were extremely polite and helpful with their suggestions. We each got a flight, a couple growlers, and some stuff from the gift store. Amazing prices definitely didn't come close to breaking the bank!! Unfortunately I don't remember the name of the guy who helped us, but I can say he was great! Made awesome recommendations of places to see and eat as we continued our quest through the city. Absolutely recommend!!!
Staff was great. Brews were great. Good price for flights
Beer was okay. Surprised that a brand like this doesn’t have a more impressive tasting room. There weren’t any windows and the decor was kind of bland. No patio.
Love their tasting room and their gift shop cool local brewery
Smart concept. Make your own flight. Bier were good. The even have a « kid » flight menu with mix homemade soft drink
No tours. Great selection of shipyard and seadog beers.
Fantastic beers to try. Awesome gift store!
Great variety of brews!
Big tasting room and alot of gifts.
Beers are so tasty and flavorful! Really large tasting room with a cool way of getting a flight of beers. Will be back!
Good experience! I suggest!!!

Thoroughly disappointed. Waited for a tour of the facility and it ended up never happening. No accountability just an apology and no effort to make it right. Their cold room must be as dirty as people say. Not many brewers still use open frementers this day in age and I was curious to see the process. However, it was a waste of my time. The beer in and of itself was trash. The service was trash. The food was okay but not up to the level of other breweries in the area. What more can I say other than hold your tongue with two fingers and say shipyard.
Lots of cool gifts, reasonably priced tasting room.
Great beer 6 bucks for a sample flight, all my choices were great. Interesting space and the soda they offer is a good non alcoholic option.
Really friendly staff. Nice, solid beers. Nothing super funky or wild-just doing normal beers right. Loved the melon and nitro stout.
Classic in town brewery. They're trying to get with the newer style brews, and the location is in ready waking distance from the old Port
Great beers and friendly, knowledgeable staff.
Commercialized brewery with sub par beers. They care more about the gift shop than the pub/brewery. No outdoor patio. Their are way better breweries in Portland, don't waste your time here.
Thought it was a nice place to chill and have some drinks. They have some games to play as well
Cool DIY flight board.
Delicious beer, lots of variety, $6 flights, nice tasting room
Had great time. Great price for flights of beers. Very friendly staff.
All of my friends enjoyed it here! Beer was tasty. A worker (maybe owner?) came over and checked on us and we all had a nice chat. Loved the store area as well. Thanks for the nice time Shipyard!
Good tours, informative but not too dry, cozy bar, cute gift shop. Flight of four 4oz beers for 6$ with a great variety of flavors. Was a good way to spend some time in Portland.
Great beers and atmosphere for tastings
Bbbb. Me
Great atmosphere for a tasting room, variety of samples of beer and soda. Very helpful staff.
I always enjoy my visits
Gift shop is 5-stars.  So is the beer.  Get there early to beat the line and grab a table.  Otherwise, you'll be standing with your flight for a while.
Really cool brewery was unable to do the tour. The atmosphere is lively and fun. The beer was decent and very affordable, there was also a cool gift shop for all your beer needs.
Great interesting selection!  Obvious why this place draws a crowd!
Came on a Monday afternoon and it wasn’t too crowded. Nice beer selection, friendly staff, and decent music made an enjoyable visit.
Great beer!

Picking your flight is really fun, great concept. But the gift shop sucks, and the tasting room was out of some of the beer we wanted. Also, it was super crowded in the early afternoon, and so very loud. Terrible acoustics. And the setup is such that you get trapped because the tables are too close together. Very stressful.

Pretty cool; they have plenty of beers to check out. We liked all the beer we sampled and it was fairly cheap! We even purchased and filled a growler for $10!! I think my only beef is that they cut off over half of thier space for merchandising. This is by far the busiest brewery around due to the proximity to Old Port; a lot of people are left begging for a place to sit or even stand to drink. They should cut the merchandise in half and open more room.
Great beer at a great price. Loved it.
Would be 5 stars if they had adequate room for everyone, their tasting room space is far too small. Beers are excellent

...we go through life looking for that perfect beverage. A beverage that will not only quench I thirst but satisfy I demanding taste and now Shipyard their Pumpkinhead Beer and Alan Pugsley has finally arrived at the solution.  Kudos to you all and thank you bringing peace, happiness and a quenched thirst into my life.  Where do we sign the petition to give Alan Pugsley a nice robust raise.   Alan ... many thanks  😉😊😊😊👌👏
Jacob is a excellent pourer and bartender. All around excellent beer and service
Not bad. Good dry stout on nitro. Tasty coffee poster. Solid ESB. No toys o.k. Tuesdays though...

Beer is good. Especially the barrel aged smashed blueberry. However, the service is in major trouble. We showed up a little after 6p in the tasting room, which advertises 7p as close, and were informed they already did last call. They made an exception and poured us two tasters. While we sipped our 8oz  of beer, the staff rushed around like mad trying to wipe down tables and clean up, while commenting on areas they couldnt clean up because guests were still around. Quite uncomfortable. Really a shame, because some of the beers have potential.

Stopped in for a quick beer...tasting room was rustic and well lit with nice decor. They have chalkboard glass holders that you fill out with your beer choices and take up to the counter that make it real easy to create a beer flight. So cute, creative, and efficient. Nice place to stop if you're in Portland and like beer!
Excellent beers, don't know about company policy...

I really like shipyard beer so it was great that one of our friends got us in for a tour. I was surprised to find out it was in the middle of downtown Portland. I don't know how many times I must've passed by the place. The tour was small and very informative. It was really cool to hear about shipyard and how to brew beer. After the tour, we got beer flights. I loved almost every single one. They're sooo good! This tour made me appreciate them more.
Staff was friendly and they had a great selection of beers. Their store was well stocked with merchandise and beer ready for you to take home and drink.
Too big now beer has gone way downhill. Lots of better choices in the area.
Very nice facility and tour, but you had to pay for the tastings at the end (granted, they were flights and not sips, but no free beer here!).
Terrible brewery who has gotten too big and is no different then your big boys.  Go find a true "craft" brewery who is more about unity then frivolous lawsuits against small breweries.
I'd rather get Sriracha enema than drink this sludge.
So you think that this is trademark infringement? Nobody from the mid west is ever going to drink your stuff again. And you need to have your eyeballs checked.

Regarding your classless lawsuit against Missouri Logboat Brewing Company:  just another case of the big guy bullying the little guy.  How ludicrous  (and insulting) to compare your crappy Shipyard can to the creative and artistic depiction on Logboat's TRADEMARKED Shiphead can.  Logboat may be smaller in size but it's much bigger in heart and integrity.  Shame on you!
Friendly staff, amazing beer choices. Had the mango tea, peach/grapefruit and a third that I forget, but they weren't sweet at all! Highly recommend. Plus the gift shop was awesome!
Love this Brewery. They are very friendly. Btw the entrance to the brewery is on Hancock St.
A must stop on the brewery tour. Always a good selection of beer
I always stop by Shipyard Brewing when i am in Portland. I love to try the beers that they are experimenting with or haven't released yet.

During our stay in Portland my bf and I went here twice. They had a good selection of things on tap and flights (4 - 4 oz. samples) of beer were only $6. It's very casual, they have different card games to play if you come with a group. If I lived in Portland I could see myself coming here often.

We stopped in for a tasting at our favorite brewery. The tasting room was packed and loud just how you'd like it to be. Choices were ample for beers (they have Shipyard and Sea Dog), 15 choices from stout, wheat, ales to whatever! $1 per 4 oz sample, super reasonably priced. Plenty of seating, just be willing to share space with strangers. They even have some local soda on tap for those who don't like to drink.  Beer is available for sale and you can mismatch in the gift shop. Other cool Shipyard and Sea Dog items are for sale too. Clean bathrooms.  A must stop in Portland!
Nice beer, and such a great deal at the bar, with inexpensive (tasty) samplers!

Nice place with good selection of beers and sodas in their tasting room. Had four 4 oz beers for $6 flight. Really liked the pumpkin, enjoyed the bourbon barrel pumpkin smash, thought the milk stout was alright, and didn't care for the flagship export. The soda flight for $1 (four sodas) my wife got was good. Really good and not too sweet root beer and ginger beer. Pretty solid cream soda and blueberry soda.
Oh my god the beer is all good here. I only had the pumpkin one before and all of them are just as good if not better.
A flight done right. All the beers we tasted were delicious!

As identified by other reviewers, Shipyard is iconic to Portland, ME but there are better places around if you take the time to look. If you want a free tasting (with no reservation), you can get that on the hour but a tour of the facility is rare. The gift shop and location really hold up this review.

This is actually one of the nicer taprooms I've been to. And honestly, $4 for a flight of THIS beer is a steal. Tried some amazing beers, poured by a friendly barkeep. Worth a stop if you're in the area and want to try the wide array they produce here!
Wonderful place, lovely beers and friendly people.
Great place and great atmosphere!!!!
Awesome store! Tasting room has been revamped and is really nice! Seasonal beers - Estival (early summer) and Pumpkinhead (late summer / fall) are especially awesome! Defiantly recommend a visit!!!
Spectacular tasting room, great beer at cheap prices.

Beautiful tasting room. They had 20 beers and sodas on tap. I sampled the sodas, $4 for a flight of 4. I enjoyed all of them except for the strawberry. My husband wasn't as impressed by the beers, he said the blueberry was too sweet and the coffee stout tasted too much like coffee. He loved the XXXX Ipa and the nitro one.  We went on a weekday afternoon and it wasn't too crowded. They only do tours on Tuesdays which is a downside. Nice gift shop with beer, clothing, and lots of other gift items.
Nice gift shop - beer not so much!
I wish I had gotten here earlier. It's Saturday. Arrived at 6:30. They close their tasting room at six. I've seen them already turn away at 10 people. How dumb.

Good place. Many other better breweries in town. As a previous poster said it does have a little bit of a corporate feel. Beer was good and people were friendly. Merch was a little expensive. Overall worth a visit.
Just amazing beer all around. You will not be disappointed with Shipyard.
Great atmosphere!!
Decent beers, $4 flight is a great deal
Bad acoustics, wait 15 minutes for a beer, but they do taste good
Disappointed across the board. Beers are too watery for my taste.

Staff was nice, the beers were tasty, though the more interesting beers erred on the sweet side.  With side and popularity and brewery has a bit of a corporate feel, but it's definitely still worth a visit.
No true tour, but the tastings were free.  Small gift shop as well.
Tasting room is very nicely set up. Great selection. $4 for a flight is totally reasonable. Will be back
The best
Great beer and nice gift shop

I went to the tasting room with some friends and the bartender was genuinely nice and knowledgeable about all of the brews on tap. Flights are $4, $1 per 1oz which is very reasonable. A joy to taste all the different options. Great prices on growlers and the stainless steel mini-keg growlers are cool too. The shop has a great selection of clothing, memorabilia and beer for purchase. I would recommend a visit to a friend.
Was disappointed that there is actually no "beer tour" as advertised everywhere, but there is a little tasting room and cool shop for souvenirs.
Wish the mint chip was around in the west coast
Great service. Very knowledgeable about there products. Fun atmosphere
First time touring a beer brewery
Love it. Stop in for a taste, leave with a case.
The american IPA is a fantastic ale
Great beer and a fun place to hang out with friends!
Great beer. I was hoping for a better tour that just a video.
The tour was awesome loved the tour guide was very informative and not one of those boring tour guides. Would recommend it to any one really enjoyed it .
New favourite Bev. All the way from the UK (England)
Best local brew. Always love the beer.

Shipyard in Portland does brew beer, or at least has fermentation tanks, but while they do tastings here, it's primary purpose is the gift shop. They do have a really nice selection of tons of merchandise including shirts, signs, mugs, and even six packs of beer. The tasting is a nice touch but was so overcrowded on the weekend that I couldn't even get a pour. Sadly not dog friendly. It'd be nice if they had more of a brew pub like the other breweries in town, but it's still a good place to get a sample.
awesome beer been drinking all day in England and come to a pub and had a pint of this stuff and its ace . love you America and I hope greg Hancock is the speedway champion again
Had a great time here awesome beer and friendly staff free sample and complimentary pint of choice was nice touch all free well worth it

One of the main motivations for visiting Maine, and specifically Portland, was to go to as many breweries as possible.  A big part of Portland's great beer reputation is Shipyard.  After doing a tasting we were definitely not disappointed.  Their public space has a large store full of their beer and clothing.  I haven't been to many breweries that do such a good job of selling their own beer in cases.  Perhaps that is because few of the "micro-breweries" are as big and successful as Shipyard.  We watched the video of the brewery's history and then went to the bar area for our tasting.  This may have been the best beer tasting we've ever had.  The large number of beers we were able to try stood out.  We really enjoyed all of Shipyard's beers.  They definitely hit the sweet spot for the many styles.  Because we were there at Thanksgiving they had their Oktoberfest beer steeply discounted.  This was music to our ears.  24-packs were so cheap (I think $12) that we had no choice but to buy a few cases.  The fact that Oktoberfest is such a drinkable beer is backed up by the fact that we only have one or two bottles left; we tried to pace ourselves.  When you go to Portland Shipyard is a must-see brewery.
Screw this place and their 10 dollar watered down drinks....
Apparently you have to join a tour in order to get any tastings. They do not accommodate walk-in tastings, nor do they offer it so beware of that.

A great brewery with a good history in ME. Definitely worth a stop by! Tour is relatively quick, not the best but quite adequate. The 'swag' shop is killer! Fantastic items for tourist and beer enthusiast alike. Love my Monkey Fist keychain!! Definitely BBG approved.
I enjoyed the place, and the pumpkin ale is my favorite drink when I go to Maine.

The "tour" is a cheesy uninformative video and a quick peek at the bottling line, narrated by someone who obviously didn't want to be there. The "tasting" is rushed. And the gift shop is ridiculously large and tacky. Regardless of how the beer tastes, avoid this brewery tour.
Seriously one of my favorite beer brewers now. Came to maine from chicago.
